authos.name: William Shakespeare
authos.biography: William Shakespeare was an English playwright, poet, and actor, widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language and the world's greatest dramatist.

authos.name: Jane Austen
authos.biography: Jane Austen was an English novelist known primarily for her six major novels, which interpret, critique, and comment upon the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

authos.name: Leo Tolstoy
authos.biography: Leo Tolstoy was a Russian writer who is regarded as one of the greatest authors of all time. His epic novels are considered masterpieces of world literature.

authos.name: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
authos.biography: Gabriel Garcia Marquez was a Colombian novelist and Nobel laureate, best known for his magical realism and portrayal of Latin American life.

authos.name: Mark Twain
authos.biography: Mark Twain, pen name of Samuel Langhorne Clemens, was an American writer known for his humor and satirical wit. He is best remembered for his novels about adventurous boys growing up along the Mississippi River.

authos.name: Agatha Christie
authos.biography: Agatha Christie was an English writer known for her detective novels and short stories. She is often called the 'Queen of Mystery' and is one of the best-selling authors in history.

authos.name: George Orwell
authos.biography: George Orwell, pen name of Eric Arthur Blair, was an English novelist, essayist, and critic. He is best known for his dystopian novel 'Nineteen Eighty-Four,' which has become a classic of modern literature.

authos.name: Harper Lee
authos.biography: Harper Lee was an American novelist known for her novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird,' a classic of modern American literature. She received the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction for this novel.

authos.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
authos.biography: J.R.R. Tolkien was an English writer, poet, philologist, and university professor. He is best known for his high-fantasy works, 'The Hobbit' and 'The Lord of the Rings,' which have had a major impact on the fantasy genre.

authos.name: Emily Dickinson
authos.biography: Emily Dickinson was an American poet known for her innovative use of language and her unconventional approach to poetry. She is considered one of the most important poets in American literature.

authos.name: Herman Melville
authos.biography: Herman Melville was an American novelist, short story writer, and poet. He is best known for his novel 'Moby-Dick,' considered one of the greatest works of American literature.

authos.name: Virginia Woolf
authos.biography: Virginia Woolf was an English writer and one of the foremost modernists of the 20th century. She is known for her innovative narrative techniques and her exploration of the inner lives of her characters.

authos.name: Charles Dickens
authos.biography: Charles Dickens was an English writer and social critic. He created some of the world's best-known fictional characters and is regarded as one of the greatest novelists of the Victorian era.

authos.name: James Joyce
authos.biography: James Joyce was an Irish novelist and poet, regarded as one of the most influential modernist writers of the 20th century. His novel 'Ulysses' is considered one of the greatest works of literature.

authos.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
authos.biography: Fyodor Dostoevsky was a Russian novelist, philosopher, and journalist. His works explore human psychology, ethics, and the dark aspects of the human psyche.

authos.name: George Bernard Shaw
authos.biography: George Bernard Shaw was an Irish playwright, critic, and polemicist. He was a prominent figure in the Fabian Society and a leading playwright of the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

authos.name: Toni Morrison
authos.biography: Toni Morrison was an American novelist, essayist, and professor. She was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature for her novels, which gave voice to the African-American experience.

authos.name: Rabindranath Tagore
authos.biography: Rabindranath Tagore was an Indian poet, philosopher, and writer. He was the first non-European to be awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature, primarily for his collection of poems 'Gitanjali.'

authos.name: J.K. Rowling
authos.biography: J.K. Rowling is a British author and philanthropist. She is best known for writing the 'Harry Potter' fantasy series, which has won multiple awards and become one of the best-selling book series in history.

authos.name: Edgar Allan Poe
authos.biography: Edgar Allan Poe was an American writer, poet, and literary critic. He is best known for his macabre and Gothic tales and his influential contributions to the development of the mystery and horror genres.
